quote_body: There's incredible facilitation power in design processes if you know how to leverage it in the right way for bringing folks to the table and setting it up so people can be successful.

My process is such where I connect with honesty, love with patience, encourage with positivity, create with care, heal with intuition, reflect with responsibility and acknowledge differences.
So, how can I be a resource and share my resources with them and this is something which may, kind of, hit the question, is conscious of co-creating with communities.

I think they have to be really mindful that it can be an anti oppressive way to hold space for individuals with lived experiences, so that they are able to share their feelings about their truth, and no one else has to kind of pinpoint that.
So I think people are always willing, they know what's happening, they wanna share stuff. So I think sharing that space again, so they feel that they are being cared for.

I feel like that, however uncomfortable and overwhelming as an experience it can be, I think universities or non-universities, however, whoever wants to take it, has to spend a good chunk of time and not just like swamped into this one month thing because that's what happened for us and it was so overwhelming

But I think, for them [acdemia/commuinties] to merge, they have to understand that there's a point they cannot really merge. They need to know when to step back and that's the truth, which they need to understand, because they are coming in from that institution and that power.
